EMAIL_HOST.description: The host to use for sending email.

EMAIL_USER.description: Username to use for the SMTP server defined in EMAIL_HOST. If empty, Django won’t attempt authentication.

EMAIL_PASSWORD.description: Password to use for the SMTP server defined in EMAIL_HOST. This setting is used in conjunction with EMAIL_HOST_USER when authenticating to the SMTP server. If either of these settings is empty, Django won’t attempt authentication.

EMAIL_PORT.description: Port to use for the SMTP server defined in EMAIL_HOST.

EMAIL_TO.description: Who should receive the mails. Will be used to create the admin account, with 'admin' password.

ALLOWED_HOST.description: The URL the application will be available on. See https://docs.djangoproject.com/fr/2.2/ref/settings/#allowed-hosts

REACT_APP_API_BASE_URL.description: The URL of the application, again. (Unused ?)

scripts.postdeploy: ./manage.py shell -c "from django.contrib.auth import get_user_model; User = get_user_model(); User.objects.create_superuser('admin', '$EMAIL_FROM', 'admin')"
